intro: Sphaerostephanos semicordatus, commonly known as the heart-shaped starwort, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. It features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical significance lies in its unique leaf structure and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
